profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-04-25 14:48:12 -0400.

did.abstract: The Student Government Association listens to the student body, creates and maintains relations between the student body and the greater Smith community, and advocates for student needs. The Student Government Association records consist of files related to office matters, the Cabinet, Senate Finance Committee, minutes and correspondence, heads of organizations, House of Reps 1966 Vietnam Poll, Social Justice and Equity committee, social regulations, photographs, and a self-published cook-book. The records span the years 1966-2016.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to researchers according to the regulations of the College Archives. Any material relating to personal information of students is restricted - please contact College Archives staff.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: These materials were transferred to College Archives in 1988, 1989, 1997, 1999, 2000, 2002, 2003, 2008-2010, 2015-2017.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: 15 of the collection's 48 boxes are arranged in 25 accessions. 33 boxes have no accession number.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Student Government Association listens to the student body, creates and maintains relations between the student body and the greater Smith community, and advocates for student needs.
The Association began as the Student Council in 1896 and retained that name until 1959. As of that year, it has held the current name.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Student Government Association records, Smith College Archives, MS-CA-01047, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Archives has not processed, rearrarranged, or weeded the materials in any way since their transfer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Student Government Association records consist of files related to office matters, the Cabinet, Senate Finance Committee, minutes and correspondence, heads of organizations, House of Reps 1966 Vietnam Poll, Social Justice and Equity committee, social regulations, photographs, and a self-published cook-book. The records span the years 1966-2016.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. All rights to this material are owned by the Smith College Archives. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the College Archives.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Jacquelyn Ottman, Class of 1977

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records of sale and budgeting, memoranda, hand-drawn fliers advertising the Koffee Klatsch and its events, photographs of volunteer staff and events, correspondence between Smith College and student leadership, table tents, invoices, 6 coffee mugs, and a self-published cook-book of favorite Koffee Klatsch member recipes.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Koffee Klatsch was a student volunteer-run coffee and pastry shop, located in Seelye Hall from the mid-1970s until the late 1980s. In conjunction with Smith College Student Government Association, the Koffee Klatsch sold food and coffee to raise funds for student activities and hosted or catered events, including mobile sales across campus, live music nights, and other activities.
